task_summary: Detect the T-shaped block and the goal outline, approach and align the circular end-effector to a push pose, orient yaw, execute one long and one fine push toward the target, then retreat and wait.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop pushing task: a circular end-effector must push a T-shaped block into a fixed T-outline target. The robot first perceives the block and the goal, moves above and precisely aligns to the block, sets its yaw to push along the required diagonal, and executes a two-stage push (coarse then fine) to settle the block inside the target outline. Finally, it retreats to clear the workspace. The scene includes a UR-style manipulator, a red T-block, and a drawn T-outline on a white table.
preconditions: Camera provides visibility of block and target
Controller running at 10 Hz for observation and control
stepwise_plan: Move above block and align precisely
Execute main push toward the target
Execute short corrective push to settle
success_criteria: Block centroid and orientation match the T-outline within tolerance
failure_and_recovery: Insufficient motion: add corrective push with smaller distance
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after retreat and final wait once the block appears seated in the outline.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

frame_5.now_evidence: block is being driven into the outline; main push underway
frame_5.predicts_next: fine correction push will likely follow

frame_2.now_evidence: tool positioned above and near the block, pre-push stance

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Position tool above the block at safe height.
Approach the block and align for pushing.
Orient end-effector yaw for diagonal push.
Short corrective push to settle the block.

failure_modes: Block not detected or goal not visible
assumptions: Frames show a red block and blue outline, while instruction mentions gray block and green target; treated as the same objects by role.
Push direction chosen as 135Â° to match the apparent diagonal toward the outline.
No explicit force control available in node library; gentle contact managed via alignment and small distances.

expected_success_criteria: Final pose visually within the T-outline
No further tool-block contact after retreat
